result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
11:27 AM Defendant Jacob S. Macek appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Peter A. Bartelt in court for Jacob S. Macek.  Attorney Amy Elizabeth Forehand in court for State of Wisconsin. Court goes over the preliminary hearing waiver that was filed by Attorney Bartelt. Court binds over for trial.

Attorney Forehand has filled the information that bring forth that same charges. Attorney Bartelt waives the formal reading and stands mute. 

Attorney Bartelt asks for a status between 30 to 45 days.
Status conference scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on November 9, 2022 at 11:00 am.

3:19 PM Defendant Jacob S. Macek in court, in custody.  Attorney Amy Elizabeth Forehand in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Peter A. Bartelt in court for Jacob S. Macek.  Attorney Bartelt waives the time limits for the preliminary hearing. Court set preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 11:30 am.
records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on September 19, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 1, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Jacob S. Macek
Current: 31779 County Hwy JJ, Lone Rock, WI 53556   (Effective: 07-25-2022)
Prior: 31536 County Hwy JJ, Lone Rock, WI 53556

4:05 PM Defendant Jacob S. Macek appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Amy Elizabeth Forehand in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Forehand states that JM is on a probation hold and they are looking at an ATR. JM has received the complaint. Max penalties stated.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 27, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Mr. Macek has called our office and she does qualify for a public defender at this time.  However, we will not have an attorney assigned by the next court date of 7/25@4:00.

9:27 AM Defendant Macek Jacob in court, in custody. Attorney Forehand appears for the state. Attorney Forehand hasn't received the report from law enforcement. Court would like to release the defendant from bond. Attorney Forehand asks that she doesn't do that due to then there would be no "no contact with the victim.'  Court reset for 07/25/22 at 4 PM
- Defendant at this time is not release for bond.
- Court had clerk inform SPD of new date and time.

1:23 PM Defendant Macek Jacob in court. Attorney Forehand appears in person. Attorney Wynes appears by video.
State asks for a $5,000 signature bond with the conditions of:
No contact with the victim or any residence that she is at.
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol and shall submit to evidentiary testing of blood, breath or urine, on demand of law enforcement, to monitor compliance. No entry into bars, taverns, or any establishment of which the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol, Phoenix Center included. 
Not to possess any dangerous weapons including knives except for kitchen knives.

Attorney Wynes doesn't object to a signature bond.

$5,000 signature bond with the conditions of:
No contact with the victim or any residence that she is at.
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol and shall submit to evidentiary testing of blood, breath or urine, on demand of law enforcement, to monitor compliance. No entry into bars, taverns, or any establishment of which the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol, Phoenix Center included. 
Not to possess any dangerous weapons including knives except for kitchen knives.

Initial set for July 22 at 9 AM
